page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY,WEST BERGHOLT
page.content: WEST BERGHOLT LITERALLY MEANS 'WOOD ON A HILL.'THE WEST IS THERE BECAUSE OF EAST BERGHOLT IN SUFFOLK.THE PARISH BOUNDARY IS APPROX.11 MILES IN CIRCUMFERENCE,WITH A TOTAL ACREAGE OF 2000 ACRES.IT IS MAINLY AN AGRICULTURAL VILLAGE,WITH QUITE A FEW FARMS.THE ESTATES HAVE CHANGED HANDS MANY TIMES,BELONGING TO AT LEAST ONE NOBLE FAMILY,THE SACKVILLES(THE VILLAGE HAS BEEN CALLED BARKHOLT- SACKVILLE AFTER THEM),THE DISTERS,THE GRIMSTONS,THE DENHAMS etc.COOK'S HALL WAS ONCE CALLED NETHER HALL,BECAUSE IT WAS ON LOWER GROUNDS THAN BERGHOLT HALL.IT IS NOW CALLED COOK'S HALL BECAUSE IT FELL INTO THE POSSESSION OF AN ADAM COOK.IN THE VILLAGE THERE USED TO BE A LOT OF HEATHLAND BUT IT HAS RAPIDLY DIMINISHED DURING THE LAST CENTURY OR SO,MOST BEING TAKEN FOR HOUSING.
